definition: to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
(negative prefix)/not/no
to endure/may/can
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to hit/to strike/to break/Taiwan pr. [ji2]

sentences.english: Just last fall he seemed imminently beatable.
sentences.chinese: 就在去年秋天他似乎還不堪一擊。

sentences.english: Write down all your ideas, no matter if they seem weak.
sentences.chinese: 記下你所有的想法，不管它是否看起來不堪一擊。

sentences.english: Low prices can always be beaten.
sentences.chinese: 低廉的價格常不堪一擊。

sentences.english: Their army is poorly trained, unable to withstand a single blow.
sentences.chinese: 越國的軍隊也缺乏訓練，不堪一擊。

sentences.english: How vulnerable is your cash flow to changes in any parameter of your calculations?
sentences.chinese: 如果計算參數變化，你的流動資金會有多麼不堪一擊？

sentences.english: The Bobcats'defense was no match for Kobe.
sentences.chinese: 山貓隊的防守在科比的進攻下不堪一擊。

sentences.english: Trust, always can not stand test, is vulnerable to something like this.
sentences.chinese: 信任，老是經不起考驗，顯得如斯不堪一擊。

sentences.english: At a single blow, the "Bösendorfer" became famous as a concert grand.
sentences.chinese: 在不堪一擊的“貝森多夫”成爲著名的盛大音樂會。

sentences.english: You have a splendid position, but it is your splendid position that makes you so vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 你身居要職，但也正是這顯赫的地位令你不堪一擊。

sentences.english: We're more like blocks, but the myriads of changes cannot withstand a single blow.
sentences.chinese: 我們的關係多像積木啊，不堪一擊卻又千變萬化。

sentences.english: Instead, they are getting shallower and more vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 反之，市場就會更加淺顯，更加不堪一擊。

sentences.english: "Love, " continues the poet, "quelled my look of stubborn pride."
sentences.chinese: 我極力保持的尊嚴在愛情面前顯得不堪一擊。

definition: the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to be determined to win (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
bruised/riddled with scars
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
bottomless pit
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
a remote and desolate place
time bomb
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to force someone to do something
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
